concept.title: Reading Custom Objects or Fields
concept.shortdesc: If the origin reads custom Salesforce objects or fields, you might want to use a Field Renamer in the pipeline to rename the custom fields.

conbody.p: If you extend Salesforce objects, custom object and field names are appended with the suffix __c. For example, if you create a custom Transaction object, Salesforce names the object Transaction__c. The Transaction object might contain fields named Credit_Card__c, Fare_Amount__c, and Payment_Type__c.
Instead of using field names appended with the suffix __c throughout the rest of the pipeline, you can add a Field Renamer to remove the suffix from the field names.
For more information about Salesforce custom objects, see the Salesforce documentation.
